They are also great at giving you more Hero Ambushes!"]]}],"_id":"x0Syy81sAoYlQAmx","detailsOutput":"This keyword represents Heroes and Villains who draw power from ambient energy, technology, or superpowers around them.
  • Some Heroes say things like \u201cYou get Empowered<\/strong> by 4.\u201d This means \u201cYou get +1<\/strong> for each <\/strong>4 card in the HQ.\u201d<\/strong><\/li>
  • On Villains and Masterminds \u201cEmpowered<\/strong> by 5\u201d means \u201cThis gets +1<\/strong> for each <\/strong>5 card in the HQ.\u201d<\/strong><\/li>
  • Uatu the Watcher is sometimes Empowered by a specific Hero Name or Hero Team, in the same way.<\/li>
  • As heroes enter and leave the HQ, an Empowered card can get stronger or weaker. You only check the bonus at the moment you play your Empowered Hero or at the moment you fight the Empowered enemy.<\/li>
  • One clever move is to recruit a Hero from the HQ at the right time, changing the colors in the HQ to weaken an Empowered enemy or try to strengthen an Empowered Hero in your hand.<\/li>
  • Some cards are even \u201cDouble Empowered\u201d, \u201cTriple Empowered\u201d, or Quadruple Empowered\u201d meaning that they get +2<\/strong>, +3<\/strong>, or +4<\/strong> for each appropriate card in the HQ.<\/li>
  • (A multicolored or divided card from counts if either half is the correct color. For example, an \u201cEmpowered by 3 and 4\u201d ability can get +1<\/strong> from a 13 card or from a 24 card. However, a \u201c34\u201d card in the HQ would only give +1<\/strong>, not +2<\/strong>.)<\/li>
  • Abilities that let you put cards from the HQ on the bottom of the Hero Deck are especially useful at setting up Empowered Heroes or Empowered Villains. They are also great at giving you more Hero Ambushes!<\/li><\/ul>"}

{"id":63,"value":"worthy","label":"Worthy","cardTypes":[1,4,5],"details":[["Many Marvel stories involve Thor and others proving whether they are worthy of wielding Asgard\u2019s mightiest weapons, like Mjolnir and Stormbreaker. {"id":9,"value":"villainousweapons","label":"Villainous Weapons","cardTypes":[2,4],"details":[["Villains and Masterminds can capture these ancient weapons to become even more powerful. But if you defeat them, you can seize those weapons to use as ",{"keyword":13,"text":"Artifacts"}," of your own. Some of them also have Ambush effects, which happen when they enter the city captured by a Villain."],{"points":[["Villainous Weapons are not Villains."],["When a Villainous Weapon is played from the Villain Deck, ",{"bold":"the Weapon is captured by the Villain in the city that\u2019s closest to the Villain Deck. If there are no Villains in the city, then KO the Weapon instead."}],["Villainous Weapons empower the Villain holding them, adding the ",{"icon":1}," bonus printed on the Weapon. Tuck the Weapon under the Villain so you can see the Weapon\u2019s ",{"icon":1}," bonus right under the Villain\u2019s ",{"icon":1},"."],["An enemy can use any number of Weapons at the same time, getting all of their bonuses combined."],[{"bold":"When a Villain with any number of Villainous Weapons escapes the city, the Mastermind captures all those Weapons"},", getting their ",{"icon":1}," bonuses."],["When you fight a Villain or Mastermind holding any number of Weapons, ",{"bold":"put all those Weapons into your discard pile as Artifacts."}],["When you have a Villainous Weapon in your hand, you can play it just like any other ",{"keyword":13},"."],[{"bold":"You never get the Weapon\u2019s printed "},{"icon":1},{"bold":" bonus"}," when you play the Artifact or control it. Only Villains and Masterminds get that ",{"icon":1}," bonus. You only get the specific Artifact abilities written on the card."],["Villainous Weapons you have captured as Artifacts ",{"bold":"have 0 cost"},", have no color or Hero Class, and don\u2019t count as Hero cards or Villain cards. Since they have no cost, Villainous Weapons can never make you Worthy. (How appropriate\u2026)"],["If you have gained a Villainous Weapon, and a card effect makes an enemy capture that Weapon again, then it works as a Villainous Weapon again until someone defeats that enemy to reclaim it."],["Malekith, Hela, and Ronan have Mastermind Tactics that turn into Villainous Weapons. You win when the Mastermind has no face down Tactics left under them, even if there are still some Tactics that have turned into other card types."]]}],"_id":"Eao88bnsF315eVNg"}
